description: On August 17, Bolivians will vote in the first round of presidential and parliamentary elections. The left appears set to pay the price for the economic crisis and internal infighting, as former president Evo Morales has been barred from running.

headline: India and Pakistan, like Israel and Palestine, remain locked in their founding disputes
description: While it is important not to conflate the two, certain similarities are evident in the trajectory of these two seemingly interminable crises, historian Jean-Pierre Filiu writes in his column.

description: In an interview with Le Monde, the former Ukrainian foreign minister under President Volodymyr Zelensky analyzes the outcome of the meeting between Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin on Friday in Alaska and discusses the next steps.

headline: Haitham Karajay, chef: 'My mother cooked every day. I was lucky to have her by my side until she died'
description: 'Refugee Recipes' (6/6). Chef Haitham Karajay sought refuge in France to escape from the Syrian civil war. He quickly turned to cooking, with the support of the NGO Refugee Food, for which he now works.

headline: In Serbia, the protest movement has turned violent, triggered by government provocations
description: President Aleksandar Vucic is facing accusations of sending hooligan groups to suppress the anti-corruption movement that has shaken the country for the past nine months.
